<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 416, 195, 432]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[48, 325, 304, 340]]<|/det|> 39 Which statement about the Universe is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 349, 301, 364]]<|/det|> A The Universe consists of 100000 galaxies. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 371, 547, 386]]<|/det|> B Redshift is a decrease in the observed wavelength of electromagnetic radiation emitted from receding galaxies. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 405, 357, 420]]<|/det|> C Light emitted from distant galaxies appears redshifted. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 426, 524, 442]]<|/det|> D Redshift of the light from distant galaxies gives evidence that the Universe is contracting. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[48, 464, 499, 481]]<|/det|> 40 Which statement about the cosmic microwave background radiation (CMBR) is correct? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 488, 410, 503]]<|/det|> A CMBR now has a frequency higher than that of infrared radiation. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 510, 345, 526]]<|/det|> B CMBR has always had exactly the same frequency. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 531, 310, 547]]<|/det|> C CMBR had a shorter wavelength in the past. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[69, 554, 407, 568]]<|/det|> D CMBR was produced a long time after the Universe was formed.
